overview.Name: Cisco Systems Inc
overview.Description: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a leading technology company based in San Jose, California, recognized for its expertise in networking hardware, software, and telecommunications solutions. With a strong emphasis on innovation in areas such as the Internet of Things (IoT) and cybersecurity, Cisco enhances enterprise communications and data security globally through its Webex platform. The company's continued focus on strategic acquisitions and significant investment in research and development solidifies its position as a key player in digital transformation and network security. By offering a comprehensive portfolio of advanced connectivity solutions, Cisco is dedicated to empowering organizations to navigate the complexities of an increasingly interconnected world.
overview.Address: 170 WEST TASMAN DRIVE, SAN JOSE, CA, UNITED STATES, 95134-1706

news.sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
news.relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: China Universal Asset Management Co. Ltd. Sells 16,909 Shares of Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO
feed.summary: China Universal Asset Management Co. Ltd. reduced its stake in Cisco Systems, Inc. by 14% (16,909 shares), now holding 103,487 shares valued at $7.18 million. Institutional investors collectively own 73.33% of Cisco, while insiders sold over 1 million shares worth approximately $79.46 million last quarter, reducing their ownership to 0.01%. Analyst ratings for Cisco are predominantly "Moderate Buy" with an average price target of $84.14, following several increased price targets.

feed.title: Coppell Advisory Solutions LLC Sells 37,952 Shares of Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO
feed.summary: Coppell Advisory Solutions LLC significantly reduced its stake in Cisco Systems, selling over 37,000 shares in Q2 and retaining shares worth about $631,000. This move aligns with broader insider selling, as multiple Cisco executives have also offloaded substantial shares recently. Despite insider divestments, Cisco reported stronger-than-expected Q2 results and provided robust FY26 guidance, alongside announcing a quarterly dividend.

feed.title: Caxton Associates LLP Has $3.30 Million Position in Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO
feed.summary: Caxton Associates LLP significantly reduced its stake in Cisco Systems, Inc. by 92.1% in Q2, bringing its total holdings to 47,609 shares valued at approximately $3.30 million. This comes as corporate insiders have also been selling shares, totaling about $79.5 million over the past 90 days. Despite these sales, Cisco exceeded Q1 earnings and revenue estimates and received multiple analyst price-target upgrades, leading to a "Moderate Buy" consensus and an average target price of $84.14.

feed.title: Caldwell Trust Co Makes New Investment in Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO
feed.summary: Caldwell Trust Co has acquired a new stake in Cisco Systems, Inc. during the second quarter, purchasing 73,894 shares valued at approximately $5.13 million. Other institutional investors like Vanguard Group Inc. and State Street Corp also increased their holdings in Cisco. The company has announced a quarterly dividend of $0.41, payable on January 21st to shareholders of record on January 2nd, representing a 2.1% yield.

feed.title: Cisco Systems (CSCO) Stock: What to Know Before the U.S. Market Opens on Dec. 15, 2025
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of Cisco Systems (CSCO) stock before the market opens on December 15, 2025. It highlights Cisco's recent record-breaking close, its positioning as an "AI networking" infrastructure beneficiary, financial performance, analyst forecasts, and potential risks, including sentiment swings in AI capital expenditure, tariffs, and competition.

feed.title: 42,115 Shares in Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO Purchased by Wellington Capital Management Inc.
feed.summary: Wellington Capital Management Inc. recently acquired 42,115 shares of Cisco Systems, Inc. ($CSCO), valued at approximately $2.92 million, making Cisco its fourth-largest holding. Despite this significant institutional buying, company insiders have sold over 1 million shares totalling $79 million in the last quarter, reducing insider ownership to a mere 0.01%. Cisco recently beat Q2 earnings estimates and provided optimistic FY2026 guidance, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus with an average price target of $84.14.

Institutional investors collectively own approximately 76.81% of the company, which currently holds a "Hold" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $89.54. feed.title: Cim Investment Management Inc. Purchases 15,294 Shares of Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO

feed.title: Headlands Technologies LLC Has $4.32 Million Holdings in Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO
feed.summary: Headlands Technologies LLC reduced its stake in Cisco Systems, Inc. by 37.2% during the second quarter, now holding 62,307 shares valued at $4.32 million. Despite this reduction, other institutional investors have increased their holdings, and the company recently announced a quarterly dividend and strong earnings results, exceeding analyst expectations. Many analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Cisco, with price targets ranging from $84.14 to $100.00.

feed.title: Cisco Systems, Inc. (CSCO) Shares Hit a record high For The First Time In Over 25 Years, Bloomberg Reports
feed.summary: Cisco Systems, Inc. (CSCO) shares recently reached a new record high for the first time in over 25 years, as reported by Bloomberg. This surge, with the stock closing at $80.25, surpassing its March 2000 dot-com bubble peak, follows a solid revenue estimate from the company and increased global investments in AI infrastructure. Despite its current market valuation being 40% below its dot-com peak, shares have risen over 800% since 2002.

feed.title: Cisco Systems, Inc. (CSCO) shares hit a record high for the first time in over 25 years, Bloomberg reports
feed.summary: Cisco Systems (CSCO) shares have reached a new record high, an achievement not seen in over 25 years, as reported by Bloomberg. This marks a significant milestone for the technology giant, reflecting renewed investor confidence or strong financial performance.

feed.title: Jim Cramer on Cisco: "This Company's at the Heart of the AI Revolution"
feed.summary: Jim Cramer views Cisco (CSCO) as an undervalued tech company central to the AI revolution despite its low price-to-earnings multiple compared to peers. He highlights the company's strong product order growth, solid balance sheet, and recent earnings and revenue increases. Cramer's Charitable Trust invested in Cisco due to its cheap valuation and CEO Chuck Robbins's reinvention efforts, dismissing concerns about an AI bubble akin to the dot-com era.

feed.title: Why Ditching Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF In the AI Era Is a Mistake
feed.summary: The article argues that discarding the Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD) because it has lagged behind tech funds during the current AI boom is a mistake. While SCHD focuses on stable dividend payers and has a low exposure to high-growth tech stocks, it offers consistent income, downside protection during market downturns, and acts as a hedge against overvalued growth sectors. For long-term investors prioritizing income and resilience over speculative gains, SCHD remains a valuable core holding.

feed.title: London Co. of Virginia Sells 99,981 Shares of Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO

feed.title: VP Subaiya Sells 1,745 ($138.7K) Of Cisco Systems Inc [CSCO]
feed.summary: VP Subaiya, a Vice President at Cisco Systems Inc (CSCO), filed a Form 4 detailing recent changes in ownership. The filing shows a surrender of 1,716 shares on December 10, 2025, and a planned sale of 1,745 shares on December 12, 2025, totaling $138,658. These transactions were executed to cover option exercise costs/tax liabilities and pursuant to a prearranged trading plan, respectively.

feed.title: Cisco: Local Leaders Using Technology To Reshape Their Landscapes
feed.summary: This article highlights how local leaders, particularly Indigenous communities like the Ogiek, are using technology to protect biodiversity and manage their landscapes. Supported by the Cisco Foundation, tools like Awana Digital’s CoMapeo and Tech Matters’ Terraso empower communities with user-friendly mapping and storytelling platforms. These technologies facilitate data collection for conservation, advocacy, and community engagement, demonstrating how place-based innovation can achieve significant environmental and social benefits.

feed.title: Cisco: Splunk and Fast Forward Partner To Empower AI-Driven Nonprofits
feed.summary: Splunk has partnered with Fast Forward, an organization that scales tech nonprofits, to empower AI-driven nonprofits. This collaboration supports initiatives using AI for social good, focusing on organizations like Closegap, which aids youth mental health, and Ersilia, which uses AI/ML to transform drug discovery in Africa. Through grantmaking, volunteering, and technological support, Splunk helps these nonprofits leverage AI ethically and responsibly to address global challenges.

feed.title: Cisco – From Classroom to Career: Ghana’s New Gateway to Tech Success
feed.summary: Cisco, through its social impact partner BASICS International, has established the Chorkor Digital Lab in Ghana to provide underserved students with vital tech skills for careers in cybersecurity and networking. This initiative, supported by Cisco Networking Academy and a Technology Grant, offers a customized program that includes Cisco's curriculum and technology. The program aims to uplift communities by empowering students with industry-standard certifications and opening doors to better job opportunities.

feed.title: How Cisco Foundation and Social Impact Investments Are Driving Impact at Scale
feed.summary: The Cisco Foundation and corporate Social Impact Investments are collectively driving global impact by leveraging people, technology, and funding to promote a healthy planet and improve well-being. Focusing on Crisis Response, Education, Economic Empowerment, and Climate Regeneration, they provide catalytic capital and support for tech-driven solutions. Their efforts, detailed in the FY24 Purpose Report, include using AI for good, expanding educational access, supporting sustainability initiatives, and fostering economic empowerment globally.

feed.title: How Cisco India Helped 50 Million People Connect to New Opportunities
feed.summary: Cisco India has successfully surpassed its 2018 goal of positively impacting 50 million lives in India by 2025, reaching this milestone in March 2025. This achievement, driven by the Cisco India Purpose Office, collaborative partnerships, and employee involvement, showcases the company's dedication to an inclusive digital future for India. Through initiatives in education, healthcare, and economic empowerment, Cisco and its partners like Indus Action, NIIT Foundation, Quest Alliance, and The Piramal Swasthya Foundation have leveraged technology to address critical needs and create lasting social impact.

feed.title: Cisco: Leveraging Technology To Transform Homeless Services
feed.summary: Cisco and Destination: Home partnered to address homelessness in Santa Clara County, focusing on leveraging technology to improve services. This led to the development of MyConnectSV, a client portal enabling individuals experiencing homelessness to access vital resources, manage information, and communicate with service providers. The platform, designed with user input, streamlines service delivery and is now replicable nationwide through a partnership with Clarity by Bitfocus.

feed.title: Fostering Connection Across Latin America With Cisco Networking Academy
feed.summary: Cisco Networking Academy is actively building partnerships across Latin America to prepare the next generation for a digital future through initiatives like the Latin American Partner Conference. This conference facilitated collaboration between academia and industry, showcasing programs from AI education in Costa Rica to cybersecurity training in Peru and Mexico. The article highlights Cisco's commitment to bridging skills gaps and fostering digital transformation throughout the region.

feed.title: Cisco – Reimagining the Modern Campus: A University’s Leap Into the Future of Learning
feed.summary: This article details how Cisco partnered with Howard University to modernize its campus IT infrastructure, moving beyond simple Wi-Fi upgrades to a comprehensive digital transformation. Led by CIO Olga Osaghae, the initiative focused on leveraging technology like AI, AV, and IoT to create a "smart campus" while prioritizing ethical use and stakeholder engagement. The collaboration aims to provide students and faculty with the tools and environment necessary for future-ready learning and societal impact.

feed.title: Igniting Our Future Workforce: Shaping the Future in Europe Through Cisco Networking Academy
feed.summary: This article highlights the Cisco Networking Academy's efforts to shape Europe's future workforce through technology education, particularly focusing on AI. It discusses the recent Europe Cisco Networking Academy Partner Conference in Thessaloniki, emphasizing the need for a skilled workforce in an AI-driven world and showcasing successful partnerships and inclusive learning initiatives. The article celebrates partners like Open University (UK), PUE (Spain), and Specialisterne, an Italian social enterprise supporting neurodivergent individuals, for their exceptional contributions.

feed.title: Cisco – Empowering People, Enabling Progress: AI and the Workforce in Africa
feed.summary: This article highlights Africa's potential to become a global leader in AI with its young, entrepreneurial population, despite current challenges such as a small AI talent pool and limited STEM enrollment. Cisco and Carnegie Mellon University Africa's report "AI and the Workforce in Africa" proposes a roadmap for the continent to build the world's largest AI workforce by investing in people, education, and infrastructure. Cisco is actively contributing through various initiatives like learning programs, partnerships, and a global AI investment fund to foster an inclusive AI future for Africa.

feed.title: Cisco – The Data Catalyst: Blended Finance Paving the Way for Climate AI Solutions
feed.summary: This article discusses how Cisco's Chief Sustainability Office is using blended finance to support climate AI solutions, focusing on the critical need for high-quality data. It highlights two case studies: investments in regenerative agriculture through Fractal FARM Fund and wildfire management through Vibrant Planet, showcasing how AI and open data are driving climate resilience. The initiatives aim to overcome data challenges and financial complexities in the climate sector by aligning capital and data for impactful solutions.

feed.title: Cisco, Amazon, and Siemens Set the Pace for Intelligent Hospitality Solutions Amid $90 Billion Market Opportunity
feed.summary: The smart hospitality market is expanding significantly, driven by digital transformation, sustainability, and automation. Key players like Cisco, Amazon, and Siemens are leading the integration of AI, cloud solutions, and robust technologies to enhance guest experiences and operational efficiency. The market is projected to grow from $35.7 billion in 2025 to $90.46 billion by 2032, presenting substantial opportunities for businesses adopting these intelligent solutions.

feed.title: Arista Networks (ANET): New Buy Recommendation for This Technology Giant
feed.summary: Mizuho Securities maintained a Buy rating on Arista Networks (ANET) with a $175.00 price target. This recommendation follows Arista Networks' latest earnings report, showing a quarterly revenue of $2.31 billion and a net profit of $853 million, significantly up from the previous year. Evercore ISI also reiterated its Buy rating and $175.00 price target, highlighting strong growth and profitability.

feed.title: Nvidia storms Ethernet switch market in challenge to Cisco, Arista
feed.summary: Nvidia has rapidly emerged as a significant player in the Ethernet switch market, challenging established leaders like Cisco and Arista Networks, with its Spectrum-X offerings driving a 167.7% year-over-year revenue increase in Q3 to $1 billion. This surge has given Nvidia 11.6% of the data center Ethernet switch market, fueled by the exploding demand for AI infrastructure. While Arista continues to grow its market share, Cisco's data center segment growth is slower, and the company is navigating competitive pressures and integrations in the market.

feed.title: Quantinno Capital Management LP Raises Stake in Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO
feed.summary: Quantinno Capital Management LP significantly increased its stake in Cisco Systems, Inc. by 28.7% in Q2, bringing its total holdings to over 1 million shares valued at primarily $74 million. Despite substantial insider selling nearing $80 million, Cisco reported strong Q3 results, beating EPS and revenue expectations, and holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus from analysts. The network equipment provider also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.41 per share.

feed.title: Cisco CFO Mark Patterson makes fun of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, says: The networking company you bought for $14 billion is ...
feed.summary: Cisco CFO Mark Patterson publicly mocked Hewlett Packard Enterprise's (HPE) $14 billion acquisition of Juniper Networks, highlighting market uncertainty and customer confusion. Patterson suggested that the integration, particularly in wireless technology where both companies have overlap, is creating opportunities for Cisco. This sentiment echoes previous statements from Cisco executives who believed the deal's disruptive potential would benefit their own business.

feed.title: United States Secure Web Gateway Market Expands Rapidly at 22.2%
feed.summary: The United States Secure Web Gateway market is projected to grow from USD 2.3 billion in 2023 to USD 12.5 billion by 2031, exhibiting a robust CAGR of 22.2%. This growth is fueled by increasing demand for advanced threat protection, the expansion of cloud-native security architectures, and advancements in AI-driven URL filtering. Key players like Palo Alto Networks and Zscaler are leading the market through continuous innovation and strategic developments.

feed.title: Extreme Networks (EXTR) Stock Forecast: Analyst Targets, 2026 Guidance and Institutional Flows as of December 11, 2025
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed look at Extreme Networks (EXTR) stock as of December 11, 2025, covering analyst targets, 2026 guidance, and institutional investment trends. It highlights the company's strong FY25 performance, positive Q1 FY26 results, and ambitious FY26 revenue targets, while also addressing risks such as negative cash flow, competitive pressures, and mixed quant/technical model signals. The report concludes that EXTR is at a critical juncture, with upcoming quarters being crucial for its long-term narrative.

feed.title: Arista Networks (ANET): Assessing Valuation After New VESPA and AVA AI Networking Launches
feed.summary: Arista Networks (ANET) has launched new campus and industrial networking tech, including VESPA architecture and upgraded AVA agentic AI, leading investors to reassess its long-term growth potential. Despite a recent volatile period, the company has shown solid share price returns, driven by its AI networking initiatives. While a valuation narrative suggests ANET is 18.1% undervalued with a fair value of $164.08, its P/E multiple appears high compared to peers and the US Communications average, raising questions about whether its growth can sustain this premium.

feed.title: Oracle earnings may not be enough to assuage debt, AI deal fears
feed.summary: Oracle faces significant investor skepticism despite a strong prior earnings outlook, primarily due to concerns about its mounting debt from capital expenditures for AI infrastructure and its reliance on a massive deal with OpenAI. The company's balance sheet is highly leveraged and free cash flow is negative, leading analysts to question the sustainability of its growth strategy. While Oracle's fiscal Q2 earnings are expected to show revenue growth, the market's focus remains on the financial risks and the perceived lack of diversity in its anticipated revenue streams.

feed.title: Arista Scales Up Campus Wireless With VESPA Tech: Stock to Aid?
feed.summary: Arista Networks (ANET) has introduced Virtual Ethernet Segment with Proxy ARP (VESPA) technology to enhance large-scale Wi-Fi networks in educational and corporate campuses. This new solution allows seamless roaming for over 500,000 devices and 30,000 wireless access points, utilizing data-center technologies for massive scalability. Coupled with an upgrade to its Autonomous Virtual Assist (AVA) using AI and LLMs for network operations, Arista aims to provide robust, cloud-driven wireless mobility and AI-powered network solutions, strengthening its market competitiveness against rivals like Hewlett Packard Enterprise and Cisco Systems.

feed.title: Pure Storage (NYSE: PSTG) approves $400 million share buyback expansion
feed.summary: Pure Storage (NYSE: PSTG) announced an additional $400 million share repurchase authorization, building on the existing program which had $20 million remaining. This new authorization, approved by the board on December 10, 2025, reflects the company's strong financial position and commitment to shareholder value, with repurchases to be funded from available cash and executed opportunistically. The program has no expiration date but may be suspended or discontinued at any time.

feed.title: NetApp and F5 Expand Partnership to Strengthen AI Data and PQC Security
feed.summary: NetApp and F5 have expanded their partnership to enhance high-performance AI data solutions and prepare enterprises for the post-quantum cryptography (PQC) era. The collaboration integrates NetApp’s intelligent data infrastructure with F5’s Application Delivery and Security Platform (ADSP) to provide secure, resilient, and scalable data delivery, especially for massive AI datasets. This initiative also focuses on protecting sensitive S3 data flows against "harvest now, decrypt later" threats by supporting PQC-ready secure communication for NetApp StorageGRID clusters.

feed.title: IBM (NYSE: IBM) and Pearson to develop AI learning tools for global workforce upskilling
feed.summary: IBM and Pearson have announced a global partnership to create AI-powered personalized learning tools for businesses, organizations, and educational institutions, aiming to address critical skills mismatches. The collaboration will leverage IBM's watsonx technologies and integrate Pearson's enterprise learning solutions, including Credly, Faethm, and Pearson Professional Assessments. This initiative will also provide Pearson's learning solutions to IBM's 270,000 employees and customers, helping people globally adapt and thrive in an evolving AI-driven workforce.

feed.title: Cisco Stock Surges Past Dot-Com Peak After 25 Years In AI-Led Comeback
feed.summary: Cisco Systems Inc. (NASDAQ: CSCO) shares reached a new record high, surpassing its dot-com era peak from 25 years ago, closing up 0.93% at $80.25. This comeback is attributed to strong AI demand, with the company beating first-quarter revenue and earnings expectations and projecting $3 billion in AI infrastructure revenue from hyperscalers by fiscal 2026. Cisco's partnerships and focus on 5G security and AI infrastructure have also fueled its 35.79% year-to-date stock surge.

feed.title: Walleye Capital LLC Takes $1.44 Million Position in Extreme Networks, Inc. $EXTR
feed.summary: Walleye Capital LLC has acquired a new stake of 79,921 shares in Extreme Networks, totaling approximately $1.44 million, representing 0.06% of the company. Extreme Networks holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with a target price of $23.83, following multiple analyst upgrades. Despite CEO Edward Meyercord selling 50,000 shares, institutional investors collectively own 91.05% of the stock.

feed.title: VFLO ETF Climbs to $39.87 With 63.6% Return - ETF Outperforms S&P 500 on Free Cash Flow Strength
feed.summary: The VictoryShares Free Cash Flow ETF (VFLO) has surged to $39.87, achieving a 63.6% return since its inception in June 2023, significantly outperforming the S&P 500. This outperformance is attributed to its aggressive exposure to technology and energy sectors and a unique methodology prioritizing high free cash flow yield. VFLO's strategy of selecting profitable U.S. companies based on free cash flow yield and forward growth metrics has positioned it as a strong value-growth hybrid.
